laboratory_examinations.findings: Stranding is seen around the distal sigmoid colon which is focally thickened. A focus of gas is seen adjacent to the sigmoid, which raises concern for microperforation vs prominent diverticulum. There is a 1.2 x 0.7 cm adjacent low density focus which is concerning for small/early abscess formation. The liver, spleen, gallbladder, pancreas, and adrenals are normal. The kidneys demonstrate symmetric contrast enhancement and brisk excretion. A 13-mm simple cyst is seen within the inferior pole of the left kidney. The small bowel is normal in caliber and enhancement. The remainder of the colon is normal in appearance.
Potassium level is 3.9 mg/dL (normal range: 2.7 - 4.5 mg/dL).
